subject: RE: [junit] generating historical graph of test results

Yeah, I considered that approach and decided against it.  I'm biased
toward writing as little code as possible, and I think the
postprocessing approach (using some of the ant task magic) will take
less code.

 

 

Todd.

 

________________________________

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
didoss@...
Sent: Thursday, June 02, 2005 12:59 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: RE: [junit] generating historical graph of test results

 

Finally found an old (Jan 2005) e-mail from Joe Rainsberger, from when I
asked a similar question,...

"I would do this by using JUnit-addons test runner and writing a custom
TestRunListener that outputs that information to whatever format you
need, including directly into the spreadsheet (using win32ole, for
example)."

-------------- Original message -------------- 
Only as far as planning and basic design.  I haven't begun implementing
it yet, due to other priorities.


Todd.


________________________________

      From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
Behalf Of didoss@...
      Sent: Tuesday, May 24, 2005 9:40 AM
      To: junit@yahoogroups.com
      Subject: RE: [junit] generating historical graph of test results
      
      
      Todd -
      
      Have you gotten anywhere with this?
      
      -------------- Original message -------------- 
      That's exactly the approach I'm planning to take.  I just didn't
want to
      build my own solution if someone's already built something to do
this.
      I guess I can assume by the lack of response on this list that
there
      probably isn't an open source tool that already does everything
I'm
      looking for.
      
      
      Todd.
      
      
      
      ________________________________
      
            From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com]
On
      Behalf Of Robert Watkins
            Sent: Thursday, May 12, 2005 5:34 AM
            To: junit@yahoogroups.com
            Subject: Re: [junit] generating historical graph of test
results
            
            
            Bradley, Todd wrote:
            > Has anyone else put something like this together?  Mike
      mentioned he's
            > heard of others who want to build such a results
graphing
      tool, but
            > didn't know if anyone's got one they're sharing.  So I'm
      posting here,
            > looking for pointers.
            
            Bradley, I've been thinking of something similar.
            
            I understand that Agitar's tool can do something like
this,
      which may be a 
            starting point if you've got more money than time (I don't
know
      the price 
            of Agitator, but I understand it's not cheap).
            
            Given your particular requirements, I would suggest using
a tool
      such as 
            CruiseControl to regularly run builds, saving the XML log
files
      away, and 
            post-processing them afterwards to produce the data you
desire.
            
            Robert.
            
            -- 
                            "Software is too expensive to build
cheaply"
            Robert Watkins         http://twasink.net/
      robertdw@...
